and investment - Economics</topcClas>         <topcClas>Nutrition - Health</topcClas>         <topcClas>Teaching packages and test datasets - Reference and instructional resources</topcClas>       </subject>       <abstract><p>Abstract copyright UK Data Service and data collection copyright owner.</p>The <i>Expenditure and Food Survey, 2005-2006: Teaching Dataset</i> includes all 6,785 households from the main <i>Expenditure and Food Survey, 2005-2006</i> (EFS) dataset (available from the UKDA under SN 5688) and a subset of 176 variables. All the variables included within the dataset are household level (or household reference person level) variables and there is a mix of discrete and continuous variables. Most of the variables are taken directly from the <i>EFS, 2005-2006</i>, however a small number of variables have been derived for the purposes of this teaching dataset. The SPSS syntax for the derivation of all derived variables is available for reference.<br> <br> (Note that the main <i>Expenditure and Food Survey</i> has now become the <i>Living Costs and Food Survey</i>, but titles of older studies in the series remain the same.)</abstract>       <abstract><B>Main Topics</B>:<br>The dataset contains a number of socio-demographic variables plus a large number of expenditure variables. <br> <br> Variables p601t \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd p612t are 'top-level' variables for a particular area of expenditure.  For example, p601t is total household expenditure on food and non-alcoholic beverages; p604t is total household expenditure on housing, water, fuel and electricity. Three of the expenditure categories are further broken down into detailed expenditure on particular items, these are:<ul><li>p601t \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd food and non-alcoholic beverage</li><li> p603t \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd clothing and footwear</li><li> p607t \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd transport costs</li></ul></abstract>       <sumDscr>         <collDate event="start" date="2005-01-01T00:00:00Z">2005</collDate>         <collDate event="end" date="2006-01-01T00:00:00Z">2006</collDate>         <nation>United Kingdom</nation>         <geogUnit>Government Office Regions</geogUnit>         <anlyUnit>Families/households</anlyUnit>         <anlyUnit>a household comprises one person or a group of people who have the accommodation as their only or main residence and (for a group) share the living accommodation (i.e. a living or sitting room), or share meals together or have common housekeeping.</anlyUnit>         <universe>National</universe>         <universe>Households in the United Kingdom surveyed during 2005-2006.</universe>         <dataKind>Numeric data</dataKind>         <dataKind> Individual (micro) level</dataKind>       </sumDscr>     </stdyInfo>     <method>       <dataColl>         <timeMeth>Cross-sectional (one-time) study</timeMeth>         <timeMeth>The EFS is an annual cross-sectional study, but this teaching dataset has been compiled using only data from the 2005-2006 survey.</timeMeth>         <sampProc>Multi-stage stratified random sample</sampProc>         <deviat>6,785 cases</deviat>         <collMode>Face-to-face interview; Diaries</collMode>         <sources />         <weight>Weighting used. See documentation for details.</weight>         <cleanOps>A*</cleanOps>       </dataColl>     </method>     <dataAccs>       <setAvail>         <accsPlac>UK Data Service</accsPlac>       </setAvail>       <useStmt>         <specPerm>Standard conditions of access</specPerm>         <restrctn>The depositor has specified that registration is required and standard conditions of use apply. The depositor may be informed about usage. See <a href=http://ukdataservice.ac.uk/get-data/how-to-access/conditions.aspx>terms and conditions of access</a> for further information.</restrctn>         <contact><a href=http://www.ukdataservice.ac.uk/help/get-in-touch.aspx>Get in touch</a></contact>       </useStmt>     </dataAccs>     <othrStdyMat>       <relStdy>7047 Living Costs and Food Survey, 2006-2012: Secure Access </relStdy>       <relPubl>   </relPubl>       <relPubl>   </relPubl>       <othRefs>Language Of Study Description: English</othRefs>       <othRefs>Language Of Study Documentation: English</othRefs>     </othrStdyMat>   </stdyDscr> </codeBook>
